---
title: "Manage groups"
---

Invite new users and assign users to specific groups to maintain access control and efficient user management within your organization via the {{< var vm_platform >}}. 

## Prerequisites

To perform these steps, you must hold the `Customer Admin` role^1^. 

::: {.column-margin}
**Learn more:**

^1^ [Users (Supported roles)](managing-users.qmd#supported-roles)

|   [Manage users (User roles)](manage-users.qmd#user-roles)
:::

::: {.callout-important}
Ensure that the group details align with your requirements for access control and group management.
:::
## See group details

1. Log in to the {{< var vm_login >}}.

1. Click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**. 

1. Under **User Permissions** in the sidebar, select **Groups**. 

1. Expand **See Details** to:
   - View the group's name and description.
   - View the complete list of members in any group.
   - View models visible to the group.

## Add new groups

1. Log in to the {{< var vm_login >}}.

1. Click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**.

{{< include _manage-groups-add.qmd >}}

## Remove groups
:::{.callout}
You can only remove non-default groups.
:::

1. Log in to the {{< var vm_login >}}.

1. Click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**. 

1. Under **User Permissions** in the sidebar, select **Groups**.

1. Expand **See Details >** for the group you want to remove.

1. Click **Delete Group** to remove it.

## Add or remove group members

1. Log in to the {{< var vm_login >}}.

2. Click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**. 

3. Under **User Permissions** in the sidebar, select **Groups**. 

#### To add a member to a group:

1. Click **See Details**.

1. Click {{< fa circle-plus >}} **Add New Member**.

1. Select members by checking the boxes next to their names in the pop-up.

1. Click {{< fa circle-plus >}} **Add to Group**.

#### To remove a member from a group:

1. Click **See Details**.

1. Select members by checking the boxes next to their names.

1. Click **Remove Member**.
